00001 /*
00002 ###############################################################################
00003 #
00004 #  EGSnrc egs++ smart envelope geometry
00005 #  Copyright (C) 2015 National Research Council Canada
00006 #
00007 #  This file is part of EGSnrc.
00008 #
00009 #  EGSnrc is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010 #  the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published by the
00011 #  Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your
00012 #  option) any later version.
00013 #
00014 #  EGSnrc is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00015 #  WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
00016 #  FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Affero General Public License for
00017 #  more details.
00018 #
00019 #  You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
00020 #  along with EGSnrc. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00021 #
00022 ###############################################################################
00023 #
00024 #  Author:          Iwan Kawrakow, 2008
00025 #
00026 #  Contributors:    Frederic Tessier
00027 #
00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A "smart" envelope geometry. The smartness is due to the fact that there
00031 #  can be only zero or one inscribed geometry per base geometry region, which
00032 #  makes many of the checks faster.
00033 #
00034 #  In addition, unlike the regular envelope geometry where all inscribed
00035 #  geometries always must completely fit inside the base geometry, here
00036 #  geometries can be inscribed using logic 0 or 1.
00037 #
00038 #  Logic 0 is as before, i.e., geometry must completely fit into the region
00039 #  where it is being inscribed.
00040 #
00041 #  Logic 1 means that the inscribed geometry extends beyond the region and
00042 #  therefore the smart envelope also checks the base geometry in this case.
00043 #  This is very similar to a CD geometry except that now the space outside
00044 #  the inscribed geometry is still part of the geometry.
00045 #
00046 #  Warning: not completely tested, so don't use for production runs yet.
00047 #
00048 ###############################################################################
00049 */
00050 
00051

00082 struct EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL SmartEnvelopeAux {
00083     EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00084     int              ireg;
00085     int              type;
00086     int              nreg;
00087     int              *regs;
00088     SmartEnvelopeAux() : g(0), ireg(-1), type(0), nreg(0) {};
00089     ~SmartEnvelopeAux() {
00090         if (nreg>0) {
00091             delete [] regs;
00092         }
00093     };
00094 };
00095 
00096 EGS_SmartEnvelope::EGS_SmartEnvelope(EGS_BaseGeometry *G,
00097                                      const vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> &fgeoms, const string &Name) :
00098     EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), geometries(0), gindex(0),
00099     reg_to_inscr(0), reg_to_base(0), local_start(0), itype(0) {
00100     if (!G) {
00101         egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: base geometry must not be null\n");
00102     }
00103     g = G;
00104     g->ref();
00105     n_in = fgeoms.size();
00106     if (!n_in) {
00107         egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: no inscribed geometries!\n");
00108     }
00109     geometries = new EGS_BaseGeometry * [n_in];
00110     nbase = g->regions();
00111     gindex = new int [nbase];
00112     itype = new char [fgeoms.size()];
00113     int j;
00114     for (j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00115         gindex[j] = -1;
00116     }
00117     for (j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00118         itype[j] = 0;
00119     }
00120     int nlist = 0;
00121     int nreg_inscribed = 0;
00122     bool ok = true;
00123     for (j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00124         geometries[j] = fgeoms[j]->g;
00125         geometries[j]->ref();
00126         int i = fgeoms[j]->ireg;
00127         if (gindex[i] >= 0) {
00128             egsWarning("EGS_SmartEnvelope:"
00129                        " There can only be a single geometry inscribed in a region\n");
00130             egsWarning(" You are trying to inscribe %s into region %d but\n",
00131                        geometries[j]->getName().c_str(),i);
00132             egsWarning(" geometry %s is already inscribed in this region\n",
00133                        geometries[gindex[i]]->getName().c_str());
00134             ok = false;
00135         }
00136         else {
00137             gindex[i] = j;
00138             itype[j] = fgeoms[j]->type;
00139             //egsInformation("inscribing %d into %d with type %d\n",j,i,itype[j]);
00140             nreg_inscribed += geometries[j]->regions();
00141         }
00142     }
00143     if (!ok) {
00144         egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: errors during definition\n");
00145     }
00146     nreg = nbase + nreg_inscribed;
00147     local_start = new int [fgeoms.size()];
00148     reg_to_inscr = new int [nreg_inscribed];
00149     reg_to_base = new int [nreg_inscribed];
00150     int nr = 0;
00151     for (j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00152         local_start[j] = nbase + nr;
00153         int nj = geometries[j]->regions();
00154         for (int i=nr; i<nr+nj; ++i) {
00155             reg_to_inscr[i] = j;
00156             reg_to_base[i] = fgeoms[j]->ireg;
00157         }
00158         nr += nj;
00159     }
00160     is_convex = g->isConvex();
00161     has_rho_scaling = g->hasRhoScaling();
00162     if (!has_rho_scaling) {
00163         for (int j=0; j<n_in; j++) {
00164             if (geometries[j]->hasRhoScaling()) {
00165                 has_rho_scaling = true;
00166                 break;
00167             }
00168         }
00169     }
00170 }
00171 
00172 EGS_SmartEnvelope::~EGS_SmartEnvelope() {
00173     if (!g->deref()) {
00174         delete g;
00175     }
00176     for (int j=0; j<n_in; j++) {
00177         if (!geometries[j]->deref()) {
00178             delete geometries[j];
00179         }
00180     }
00181     if (geometries) {
00182         delete [] geometries;
00183     }
00184     if (gindex) {
00185         delete [] gindex;
00186     }
00187     if (reg_to_inscr) {
00188         delete [] reg_to_inscr;
00189     }
00190     if (reg_to_base) {
00191         delete [] reg_to_base ;
00192     }
00193     if (local_start) {
00194         delete [] local_start;
00195     }
00196     if (itype) {
00197         delete itype;
00198     }
00199 }

00201 void EGS_SmartEnvelope::printInfo() const {
00202     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00203     egsInformation(" base geometry = %s (type %s)\n",g->getName().c_str(),
00204                    g->getType().c_str());
00205     egsInformation(" inscribed geometries:\n");
00206     for (int j=0; j<n_in; j++) egsInformation("   %s (type %s) in region=%d, "
00207                 " itype=%d\n",
00208                 geometries[j]->getName().c_str(),geometries[j]->getType().c_str(),
00209                 reg_to_base[j],(int)itype[j]);
00210     egsInformation(
00211         "=======================================================\n");
00212 }

00215 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message1[] =
00216     "createGeometry(smart envelope): %s\n";
00217 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message2[] =
00218     "null input?";
00219 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message3[] =
00220     "no 'base geometry' input?";
00221 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message4[] =
00222     "incorrect base geometry definition";
00223 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message5[] =
00224     "missing/incorrect 'base geometry' input";
00225 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message6[] =
00226     "createGeometry(smart envelope): no geometry with name %s defined\n";
00227 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message7[] =
00228     "no inscirebed geometries defined?. I hope you know what you are doing";
00229 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message8[] =
00230     "an error occured while constructing inscibed geometries";
00231 
00232 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword1[] = "base geometry";
00233 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword2[] = "geometry";
00234 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword3[] = "inscribed geometries";
00235 
00236 extern "C" {
00237 
00238     EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry *createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00239         if (!input) {
00240             egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message2);
00241             return 0;
00242         }
00243         //
00244         // *** Base geometry
00245         //
00246         EGS_Input *i = input->takeInputItem(eeg_keyword1);
00247         if (!i) {
00248             egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message3);
00249             return 0;
00250         }
00251         EGS_Input *ig = i->takeInputItem(eeg_keyword2);
00252         EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00253         if (ig) {  // defined inline
00254             g = EGS_BaseGeometry::createSingleGeometry(ig);
00255             delete ig;
00256             if (!g) {
00257                 egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message4);
00258                 delete i;
00259                 return 0;
00260             }
00261         }
00262         else {  // defined via a name of a previously defined geometry
00263             string bgname;
00264             int err = i->getInput(eeg_keyword1,bgname);
00265             delete i;
00266             if (err) {
00267                 egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message5);
00268                 return 0;
00269             }
00270             g = EGS_BaseGeometry::getGeometry(bgname);
00271             if (!g) {
00272                 egsWarning(eeg_message6,bgname.c_str());
00273                 return 0;
00274             }
00275         }
00276         vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> fgeoms;
00277         int nbase = g->regions();
00278         EGS_Input *ix;
00279         while ((ix = input->takeInputItem("inscribe geometry")) != 0) {
00280             vector<string> values;
00281             ix->getInput("inscribe geometry",values);
00282             if (values.size() < 2) egsWarning("createGeometry(smart envelope):"
00283                                                   " %d inputs for 'inscribe geometry'? 2 or more are needed\n",values.size());
00284             else {
00285                 EGS_BaseGeometry *gj = EGS_BaseGeometry::getGeometry(values[0]);
00286                 if (!gj) {
00287                     egsWarning(eeg_message6,values[0].c_str());
00288                 }
00289                 else {
00290                     SmartEnvelopeAux *aux = new SmartEnvelopeAux;
00291                     aux->g = gj;
00292                     aux->ireg = atoi(values[1].c_str());
00293                     aux->type = values.size() == 3 ? atoi(values[2].c_str()) : 0;
00294                     //egsInformation("set geometr: %s %d %d\n",values[0].c_str(),aux->ireg,aux->type);
00295                     if (aux->ireg < 0 || aux->ireg >= nbase) {
00296                         egsWarning("createGeometry(smart envelope): wrong "
00297                                    "region index %d for inscribed geometry %s\n",
00298                                    aux->ireg,gj->getName().c_str());
00299                         delete aux;
00300                     }
00301                     else {
00302                         fgeoms.push_back(aux);
00303                     }
00304                 }
00305             }
00306             delete ix;
00307         }
00308         EGS_BaseGeometry *result = new EGS_SmartEnvelope(g,fgeoms,"");
00309         result->setName(input);
00310         result->setLabels(input);
00311         for (int j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00312             delete fgeoms[j];
00313         }
00314         return result;
00315 
00316     }
00317 
00318     void EGS_SmartEnvelope::getLabelRegions(const string &str, vector<int> &regs) {
00319 
00320         // label defined in the envelope geometry
00321         g->getLabelRegions(str, regs);
00322 
00323         // label defined in the inscribed geometries
00324         vector<int> gregs;
00325         int shift=0;
00326         for (int i=0; i<n_in; i++) {
00327 
00328             // add regions from set geometries
00329             gregs.clear();
00330             if (geometries[i]) {
00331                 geometries[i]->getLabelRegions(str, gregs);
00332             }
00333 
00334             // shift region numbers according to indexing style
00335             for (int j=0; j<gregs.size(); j++) {
00336                 gregs[j] += local_start[i];
00337             }
00338 
00339             // add regions to the list
00340             regs.insert(regs.end(), gregs.begin(), gregs.end());
00341 
00342         }
00343 
00344         // label defined in self (envelope geometry input block)
00345         EGS_BaseGeometry::getLabelRegions(str, regs);
00346 
00347     }
00348
